page.title: 05TOURISM IN SW.BOGNOR REGIS
page.content: Since the late{1700's}tourists have visited Bognor Regis for the sea and sea-air.Nowadays as many as{14,000,000 people visit Bognor Regis each year. The busiest times are{July, August and {September.}Most of the visitors come from London and the south. They are attracted to the area by advertisements in national papers and brochures sent out by the{tourist {office}situated in this area.As well as the{beaches}and{mild climate}Bognor offers other attractions such as Butlin's,further along the coast, {sports facilities}and an{entertainment {centre.}It is a good base to visit the many places of interest in the {Arun region.}There are many hotels, guest houses, caravan and camp sites to accommodate people though many visitors are{day trippers. Foreign {students}are also regular visitors.
